intro: Morinda macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved morinda, is a shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Morinda macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
